main event: A bright yellow flare was visually observed rising through the undercast to an altitude of approximately 1,400 feet, then falling back towards the ocean and burning out on the way down.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by an aircraft to Lajes Air Force Base at 0342Z.
There was no radar contact with the object, and the pilot was unable to investigate further due to the undercast.
The object was described as a bright yellow flare, burning out on the way down.
The sighting occurred at a position approximately 30 miles northeast of coordinates 34.22N, 70.45W in the Atlantic Ocean.
Officials concluded that the sighting was likely a flare, but were unable to investigate further due to the lack of a specific location.
location: Atlantic Ocean, approximately 30 miles northeast of 34.22N, 70.45W
photographs: Yes, the report includes a photograph of the flare
